title: Quotes website featuring non-famous people

requirements.text: Implement backend data model and APIs to store and retrieve quotes from non-famous people, including creating a quote and listing quotes.

quotes: Create a website for quotes from non-famous people

acceptanceCriteria: A Quote record includes at minimum: id, text, authorName (non-famous person), createdAt timestamp.
Backend exposes canister methods to: createQuote(text, authorName) and listQuotes({page?, pageSize?}).
Quotes persist across canister upgrades using stable storage.
Backend validates inputs (non-empty text and authorName; reasonable max lengths) and returns clear error messages.

requirements.text: Create a frontend that showcases quotes from non-famous people with a home feed and a quote submission form.

quotes: Create a website for quotes from non-famous people

acceptanceCriteria: Home page displays a scrollable list/feed of quotes with quote text and author name.
A “Submit a quote” flow exists with a form for quote text and author name and a submit button.
After successful submission, the new quote appears in the feed without requiring a manual refresh (React Query invalidation/refetch).
Loading and error states are shown for both listing and submission.

requirements.text: Add basic browsing utilities to help users discover quotes, including search by text/author and simple sorting.

quotes: Create a website for quotes from non-famous people

acceptanceCriteria: Frontend provides a search input that filters quotes by matching quote text or author name (case-insensitive).
Frontend provides a sort control with at least: Newest first and Oldest first.
Backend supports listing with optional query parameters needed to implement search and sorting efficiently (or frontend filtering if dataset is small), with documented behavior in code comments.

requirements.text: Apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme across the site (colors, typography, spacing, and components) suitable for a quotes-focused reading experience, avoiding blue/purple as the primary palette.
acceptanceCriteria: UI uses a consistent theme (e.g., warm paper-like background, ink-like text, accent color) across all pages/components.
Typography emphasizes readability for quote text (clear hierarchy between quote text and author name).
Theme is applied consistently to feed items, buttons, inputs, and headers using Tailwind + existing UI components (without editing immutable component source files).

requirements.text: Add static generated image assets for branding and ambiance and render them in the UI (stored under frontend/public/assets/generated).
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are placed in frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend (no backend routing).
Site displays the logo in the header and uses the background/texture in a visually subtle way (e.g., hero or page background).

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo (no additional backend services).
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or other paths marked immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Use English for all user-facing text.
nonGoals: Internet Identity authentication and user accounts.
Admin moderation workflows, reporting, or advanced content review.
External database or third-party API integrations.

required: Minimal typographic logo mark with a quote motif, warm neutral palette (quotes-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Subtle paper grain / texture background, seamless or large canvas (paper-texture.dim_1600x900.png)
